poem:
Title: Ballot's Echo

In blithe morbidity, they sow,
A spectre, canvas white.
Streeting preaches a metaphor's glow,
Matches to an arsonist, ignite.

Victory suspected, the complacent mock,
In murmur of the polling flock.
Labour's warning, a silent knock,
On the nightmare's ticking clock.

Irony, the plea of the feast,
For fire and arsonist are all but leased,
On Downing Street's troubled breast,
Where crows upon ambition nest.
